definition[0]: to exchange goods, work, or services for other goods or services rather than for money
example[0]: I had to barter with the locals for food.
example[1]: They bartered their grain for salt.
definition[1]: a system of exchanging goods and services for other goods and services rather than using money
example[2]: Trading was carried out under a barter system.
definition[2]: goods or services that are exchanged by bartering
definition[3]: to exchange goods for other goods or to do work for someone in exchange for work they do for you, rather than using money
example[4]: They import used cars, which they then barter for consumer goods.
definition[4]: a system of exchanging goods or work for other goods or work, rather than using money
example[5]: When people want to exchange any goods, they do so by barter.
